techmeme.title: Xiaomi unveils the Mix Fold 4, starting at ~$1,237, and the Mix Flip, its first flip foldable, with a 4.01" cover display, starting at ~$825, available in China (Damien Wilde/9to5Google)
Over 200 Bethesda Game Studios workers unionize with the CWA, forming the first "wall-to-wall" union at a Microsoft game studio; Microsoft recognized the union (Dean Takahashi/VentureBeat)
Oracle agrees to pay $115M to settle a lawsuit accusing it of invading people's privacy by collecting their personal information and selling it to third parties (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
Sources: Google recently approached EssilorLuxottica's leadership about putting its Gemini AI assistant in future smart glasses (Alex Heath/The Verge)
A profile of CrowdStrike, founded in 2011 and used by 300 companies in the Fortune 500; Gartner: CrowdStrike has ~15% of the global security software market (Robert McMillan/Wall Street Journal)
